title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 16 February 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:37 <jvdrean> has quit  
01:29 <DrLou> has quit  
02:14 <sburjan`> has quit  
02:58 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
04:08 <CIA-120> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r1246575 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/124657535b1674322d1cbfe614859171dfd1f9b6 / (14 files in 5 dirs): [misc] Fixed wrong file attributes - http://git.io/G5LHcw  
04:08 <CIA-120> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r523616d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/523616d94dda09c96078ceb63d01f16b4781bff9 / (2 files): XWIKI-6227: Search UI should only display spaces with view right in the space selection box ...  
04:27 <@sdumitriu> XWIKI-1000  
05:59 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
05:59 <Denis> has quit  
07:31 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:32 <rrodriguez> has quit  
08:00 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:35 <CIA-120> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* rcf1253d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/cf1253d69c43a5797f50c6e45ee0d7ef4e29336e / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-6304: Limit dragable width of textareas in FF4 and Chrome ...  
08:40 <CIA-120> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r25f8596 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/25f8596ce566a905c5a5d967545aaee257edfd26 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/web/XWikiAction.java : [misc] Renamed function parameter for clarity - http://git.io/FBy0oQ  
08:44 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
09:20 <+Denis> sdumitriu: the location of the attachement storage is not the environment.permanentDirectory ?  
09:20 <@sdumitriu> Should be somewhere inside there  
09:20 <+Denis> its not  
09:20 <+Denis> seems to be inside the work directory on my side  
09:21 <+Denis> the one I consider cache and not data  
09:21 <@sdumitriu> It definitely shouldn't be there  
09:21 <+Denis> it should not, but it is, this is why I am asking  
09:22 <@cjd> it used to be there but I thought that was changed when permanentDirectory was implemented  
09:24 <+Denis> ok  
09:24 <+Denis> I know  
09:24 <+Denis> but I am on latest build here, so it should be right no ?  
09:25 <@cjd> looking at the code, I guess it didn't get fixed.  
09:33 <+Denis> oh, its legacy code ?  
09:33 <+Denis> why legacy ?  
09:34 <+Denis> you means bridge ?  
09:35 <@cjd> attachments predated permanentDirectory, when that was added it just never got updated  
09:35 <@cjd> (FS attachments)  
09:37 <+Denis> yes, are you fixing it ?  
09:38 <@cjd> yes  
10:03 <+mflorea> We have an issue on CI, at least on agent-6, when running functional tests. The web server (jetty) is not properly shutdown and the next modules fail to build, because the port is already in use. Is this a configuration problem on agent-6 (and others maybe) or a bug in XWiki?  
10:05 <vmassol> mflorea: does it work on other agents?  
10:05 <+mflorea> for instance, this morning, exterprise-test-ldap tests passed but failed to close jetty http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ldap/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ldap/895/consoleText  
10:05 <vmassol> we're shutting down the server for sure in our tests  
10:05 <vmassol> now we need to find out why it's not closed  
10:06 <vmassol> or maybe a test is failing on agent6 and we have a bug in some conditions when we don't shut it down  
10:06 <vmassol> and we don't see it on other agents because the test passes  
10:06 <vmassol> ?  
10:07 <+mflorea> then subsequent functional tests fail, like this http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webdav-3.5/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webdav/6/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.integration/XWikiTestSetup/junit\_framework\_TestSuite\_4737371/  
10:08 <+mflorea> well, it seems like jetty is not closed on agent-1 neither, for instance, this ui-tests run on agent-1, and at the end http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/982/console I see that it fails to close jetty  
10:09 <+mflorea> I don't have this problem locally  
10:17 <+Denis> cjd: what about migration ?  
10:18 <+Denis> it could be unoticed and corrupt an upgraded wiki, no ?  
10:18 <@cjd> how would it cause corruption?  
10:19 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <+Denis> mistmatch between DB and FS  
10:20 <@cjd> it doesn't trash the db when it can't find the files, the attachments just don't show up.  
10:21 <+Denis> but new attachment could be added  
10:22 <+Denis> than the situation became not easy to merge, no ?  
10:22 <@cjd> migration is something I'd like to work on over the next few months since I have a new fs attachments implementation in a branch, but migration is scary stuff and it requires attention to detail and lots of review.  
10:23 <+Denis> sure, what I am wondering is that changing the way you determine where attachement are, is an issue  
10:24 <+mflorea> vmassol: actually, there is a jetty hanging on agent-6 since yesterday. I though restarting agent-6 from Jenkins UI (by disconnecting it) will close the web server, but it didn't..  
10:24 <vmassol> ok  
10:25 <+Denis> cjd: AFAIK, the default for the permanent directory is not the old working directory  
10:26 <@cjd> IMO the risk of someone uploading new attachments with the system in (an obviously) broken state is relitively small. So we could either A) commit the patch and add a note in the release notes that attachment storage location has moved, or B) wait until we have a safe fs migrator, in which case I'd propose moving to the attachment store I have in the branch.  
10:26 <+Denis> which really means that a not updated config will have many chance to break stuffs  
10:27 <@cjd> I'm not very happy about the idea of hunting for attachments on the filesystem and just moving files around, esp. without the admin's permission  
10:27 <+Denis> sure  
10:28 <+Denis> I would be +1 for commiting the patch on 4.x  
10:28 <@cjd> given the amount of discussion I think we need to at least run it by the list  
10:28 <+Denis> there will very hot changes there which will require user attention to the release notes  
10:29 <+Denis> and IMO, moving the storage folder is a work for the admin, not you  
10:29 <@cjd> I agree on that point  
10:30 <+Denis> I just do not want this in a late 3.5 which is stabilization and probably deserve less attention  
10:30 <@cjd> ./xwiki --upgrade-attachment-store ./storage  
10:30 <@cjd> might be nice  
10:30 <+Denis> ?  
10:31 <@cjd> for the future.. a command line method of upgrading storage  
10:31 <+Denis> not really something we have in a container  
10:31 <@cjd> /nod  
10:31 <+Denis> but for the simple setup, why not  
10:31 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <+Denis> what do you do ? I d'like to have your patch asap  
10:32 <@cjd> I'll just run it by the list but I'm satisfied with commit and add to release notes.  
10:33 <@cjd> Admins who have FS attachments turned on are going to be more alert types anyway.  
10:33 <+Denis> can I have your patch in the meantime ?  
10:33 <@cjd> let me build enterprise and run some testing on it  
10:33 <@cjd> \*functional tests  
10:34 <+Denis> I could test as well :)  
10:35 <@cjd> http://xwiki.pastebay.org/308045  
10:36 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <rrodriguez> has quit  
10:36 <+Denis> thanks  
10:37 <@cjd> thanks for testing it  
10:42 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:49 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
10:49 <+Denis> cjd: what is the metadata file for ?  
10:50 <@cjd> it's versioning metadata  
10:50 <+Denis> ok  
10:50 <@cjd> that is the metadata for each version of the attachment  
10:50 <+Denis> so it is working for me, since versionning is void  
10:50 <vmassol> we're getting this one again: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-crypto/1523/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.crypto.passwd/PBKDF2KeyDerivationFunctionTest/initializationProcessorTimeGuessingTest/  
10:50 <vmassol> :(  
10:51 <vmassol> I've had it locally too  
10:51 <vmassol> the code is taking too much time to execute  
10:51 <@cjd> I should turn that off because that code hasn't changed since it was new  
10:51 <vmassol> which is a bug in itself  
10:51 <@cjd> it doesn't really validate anything  
10:52 <vmassol> cjd: the time is taken in the test and not in the code?  
10:52 <vmassol> (ie if I run this on XE on some linux it won't take long?)  
10:52 <@cjd> the test makes a purposely hard problem so that it can benchmark  
10:52 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:57 <sdumitriu> has quit  
11:05 <vmassol> wow never seen this one:  
11:05 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/982/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.ui.scheduler/SchedulerTest/testJobActions/  
11:05 <vmassol> "integrity constraint violation: unique constraint or index violation; SYS\_PK\_10169 table: XWIKIRCS "

11:44 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea stable-3.5.x \* r8290152 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/829015241e287e50b3c9284b0b7a612d9b0fdb96 / (2 files in 2 dirs): Update translations. ...  
12:23 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea xwiki-commons-3.5-milestone-1 \* r177f220 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/177f22014c4e8dccf49cefa6af6456cfca0cafc1 / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-commons-3.5-milestone-1 - http://git.io/IMXwOQ  
12:23 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea xwiki-commons-3.5-milestone-1 \* rb2a6122 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/b2a612200cbd08b40df6ff2ba422ce29e1e64196 / (36 files in 36 dirs): [maven-release-plugin] prepare release xwiki-commons-3.5-milestone-1 - http://git.io/tDTyYA  
12:35 <CIA-120> Jerome Velociter ldap-ui \* rcd0e486 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/cd0e4864297043bb1c699580966301dfeade1209 / (4 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-2551 Create a LDAP administration app ...  
12:41 <+mflorea> vmassol: xwiki-rendering build fails when releasing  
12:41 <+mflorea> [ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project xwiki-rendering-syntax-wikimodel: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.xwiki.rendering:xwiki-rendering-syntax-wikimodel:jar:3.5-milestone-1: Could not find artifact org.wikimodel:org.wikimodel.wem:jar:2.0.7-20110531 in central (http://repo1.maven.org/maven2) -> [Help 1]  
12:41 <vmassol> yes it's not in central  
12:41 <vmassol> you need the xwiki nexus repo as your remote repo  
12:42 <vmassol> in your settings.xml  
12:42 <vmassol> that's one of the reason I proposed to fork wikimodel btw ;)  
12:42 <+mflorea> I'm doing the release from the agent, this didn't happen before  
12:42 <+sburjan> Hello everybody. I have found something unusual about importing. Let me present my test case  
12:42 <vmassol> it was there  
12:42 <vmassol> always been there  
12:42 <vmassol> so that's strange  
12:43 <+mflorea> let me check  
12:44 <+sburjan> Downloaded 3.5-SNAPSHOT jetty+hsqldb. Attached a file to Main.WebHome. Re-imported the XAR with the default option. I get no more attachments on Main.WebHome. Only way to be able to download my attachment is to rollback to the prior version. Clicking on the revision history, won't make my attachment downloadable.  Is this normal ?  
12:46 <+sburjan> this could be a blocker  
12:46 <+mflorea> vmassol: I see this in settings.xml http://pastebin.com/PeFPc9YH  
12:47 <vmassol> are you using maven 3.0.4?  
12:48 <+mflorea> nop, 3.0.3  
12:48 <vmassol> I don't know  what the problem is but the message clearly shows it's looking for it on maven central  
12:49 <vmassol> I have to run mflorea (I'm giving a presentation and I need to travel to Paris in a few minutes - need to eat first)  
12:49 <+mflorea> ok, np, I'll find a solution  
12:56 <mflorea> has quit  
13:05 <evalica> has quit  
13:08 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:24 <vmassol> has quit  
13:39 <CIA-120> Eduard Moraru feature-annotations-merged-with-comments \* r8540cd8 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/8540cd858232c14e17c8a1b7c9bee4566904ba3d / (12 files in 5 dirs): XWIKI-7540: Merge Annotations with Comments. - http://git.io/OlFDaw  
14:09 <azn> has joined #xwiki  
14:09 <azn> hi all  
14:09 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:11 <azn> i tried to execute this xwql statement: where doc.object(Contacts.ContactClass).lastname like '%$!{request.lastname}%' and doc.object(Contacts.ContactClass).jobtitle like '%title%'  
14:11 <azn> but i see error  
14:12 <azn> supports  xwiki queryes like this?  
14:33 <jvdrean1> has joined #xwiki  
14:33 <jvdrean> has quit  
14:34 <@cjd> I think that works, that said, putting $!{request.lastname} into a query is giving anyone who sends a request to that page authority to run arbitrary XWQL  
14:35 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:35 <@cjd> maybe it doesn't matter, maybe it does, it's just important to know when you transfer authority.  
14:36 <dbaeli> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <azn> query works fine, if the condition is present only 1 property  
14:39 <azn> when i try add another property from the same class i got an error  
14:41 <@cjd> that sounds like a possible bug  
14:41 <azn> yep  
14:42 <@cjd> if you feel like reporting it, that would be great, if it turns out that it's expected behavior (I'm not an expert on how that parser functions) we can always close it later  
14:47 <azn> i din't know how i can report a bug  
14:48 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:51 <@cjd> http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa <-- this is our bug tracker

20:43 <qwebirc23608> Hi, I'm thinking about use xwiki on the University where I'm member of TI Group, but I have a question: The xwiki uses OpenLdap authentication, but it uses OpenLdap Authorization? XWiki map OLdap groups and uses it to authorize the access on documents or pages?
